title: Prohibits payments from the Judicial Supplemental Support Fund to certain judges for expenses for services and goods
summary: Prohibits payments from the Judicial Supplemental Support Fund to certain judges for expenses for services and goods to support such judges in the performance of their judicial responsibilities.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2873

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 20, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. CALHOUN -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Judiciary

       AN ACT to prohibit  certain  payments  from  the  Judicial  Supplemental
         Support  Fund  for  the  purpose  of  reimbursing  judges for expenses
         related to services and goods in support of their  judicial  responsi-
         bilities

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Chief Judge
    2  of the state of New York shall be  prohibited  from  approving  payments
    3  from  the  Judicial  Supplemental  Support Fund to judges of the Unified
    4  Court System for expenses for services and goods to support such  judges
    5  in the performance of their judicial responsibilities.
    6    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02863-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to prohibit certain payments from the Judicial Supplemental Support Fund for the purpose of reimbursing judges for expenses related to services and goods in support of their judicial responsibilities
